If you meet someone you don‚Äôt like but who isn‚Äôt violating the Community Rules, you can block the person.


These rules were last updated on 1/28/22
posts.description: Fortnite Creative aims to be a safe and welcoming environment. Please read our content rules and guidelines.
posts.author: The Fortnite Team

posts.title: The Green Goblin Glides into Fortnite in Search of Spider-Man
posts.content:
He won't rest until he's destroyed Spider-Man. Tipped off by the towering Daily Bugle, the Green Goblin has followed Spider-Man to the Fortnite Island. Get the Green Goblin Outfit and more Green Goblin Set items in the Item Shop starting now!


A Bag of Tricks: See the Green Goblin Set



With his costume based on a nightmare, it‚Äôs only appropriate the other Green Goblin items fit the bill. Here are all the Green Goblin items in the Shop besides the Outfit: 

  • Pumpkin Bomb Back Bling (sold with the Outfit): Made in a convenient "DESTROY EVERYTHING!!!!" size.

  • Pumpkin P'axe: Practical? No. But staying on theme is so important for a Super Villain.

  • Goblin Glider: The electromagnetism of this Glider keeps the rider‚Äôs feet locked on.

  • Arm the Pumpkin! Emote: See it in action below!
     

Hope you brought enough to share...


Players can purchase the Outfit (+ Back Bling), Pickaxe, Glider, Emote individually or as part of the Green Goblin Bundle. This bundle additionally includes the Attack of the Goblin Loading Screen:

Does he make you smile? Forget it!


The rivalry between Spider-Man and the Green Goblin continues on the Island. Don‚Äôt own the Spider-Man Outfit but want it in your collection? This Outfit‚Äôs featured in the Chapter 3 Season 1 Battle Pass.
posts.description: The Green Goblin, Spider-Man‚Äôs greatest foe, glides onto the Fortnite Island. Get his Outfit or the entire Green Goblin Set. Find him in the Fortnite Item Shop.
posts.author: The Fortnite Team

posts.title: Fortnite Battle Royale v19.10 Jan 25 Hotfix: Throw a Pizza Party for the Squad!
posts.content:
Something‚Äôs new on the Pizza Pit menu! Say hello to ‚ÄúPizza Party‚Äù: a large box of hot and fresh Slurpshroom Pizza. 


Share a Pizza Party: Eight Slices for the Squad

Thanks to the Pizza Pit at Tilted Towers no longer being covered by snow, pizzas are being produced non-stop! Find Pizza Party boxes scattered throughout the Island, then throw one down for an instant feast with the squad. (Literally throw a party.) These boxes of Slurpshroom Pizza contain eight surprisingly nutritious slices ‚Äî eat them to restore Health and Shield simultaneously 'til you get to 100 Health and 50 Shield.



Devour slices straight from the box or store some to save for later. You can find Pizza Party boxes in Chests, Supply Drops, Loot Llamas, and on the ground. (We don‚Äôt judge for eating pizza found on the ground.) And of course, you can purchase some with Bars from Tomatohead!


Competitive Notes

  • Pizza Party boxes are currently not in competitive playlists but are subject to an evaluation period.

  • In our v19.20 patch next week, we will be adjusting Spider-Man‚Äôs Web-Shooters to have 20 shots instead of 80 in competitive playlists. This lower count encourages players to make more strategic decisions about when to use the item, while retaining the item‚Äôs usefulness as a powerful mobility tool.
posts.description: Restore Health and Shield with Pizza Party boxes in Fortnite! These boxes of Slurpshroom Pizza are delivered in the Fortnite Battle Royale v19.10 Jan 25 hotfix.
posts.author: The Fortnite Team

posts.title: Save the World | Homebase Status Report 1.24.2022
posts.content:
Greetings Commanders,
In case you missed it, be sure to checkout Lars' update about The Storm that was added to the previous Homebase Status Report.

Also in the v19.10 update, Commanders gained the ability to cancel Goin' Commando and Lefty and Righty activations. Use this new found cancel ability to get out of tricky situations!

Winterfest is melting away, so now it is time to welcome back the Mild Meadows Ventures Season! Some scouting reports are saying that things may be getting a bit feral during this Ventures Season; but we will cross that bridge when it comes.

For now let‚Äôs focus on getting this report rolling. Homebase Status Report - Initiate! 
 

Coming January 24 (7 PM ET) - Mild Meadows Returns, Major Oswald Drills you in the Wargames, Wukong descends into the Event Store along with the Dragon‚Äôs Fist, and follow Stoneheart Farrah‚Äôs teachings in the No Dancing Questline

 


 

The Mild Meadows

Here in the Mild Meadows, Commanders get to enjoy the benefits of the Escalation Modifier. The Escalation Modifier is as simple as it is effective, here is a rundown of how it works; as your Commanders‚Äô elimination streaks climb, your team will receive a small boost to bonus damage (capping out at a 100% increase). In addition, reaching elimination streaks will trigger an Elemental Burst at all Commanders‚Äô locations, dealing damage and unleashing additional effects!

30 Eliminations: Nature Burst - Mother Nature is on your side! This burst damages and stuns surrounding enemies for 3 seconds.

60 Eliminations: Fire Burst - Is it getting hot in here or is that just your elimination streak? This burst will deal damage and apply a blistering debuff which causes damage every second.

90 Eliminations: Dance Party - Make em‚Äô dance! This burst deals damage, refills Commander‚Äôs energy, and last but certainly not least, causes the Husks to dance for 7 seconds.

120 Eliminations: Ice Burst - After heating them up with some fire and dancing, it‚Äôs time to cool them down! This burst will deal damage and freeze nearby targets for 5 seconds.

150 Eliminations: Energy Burst - And now it‚Äôs time to unleash the power! This burst will damage and cause nearby enemies to take increased damage for 10 seconds.

Keep in mind, if you lose your streak your Escalation bonuses will reset. So keep it moving and take out as many Husks as you can as fast as you can!
 

 

Wargames

Major Oswald will do anything to sharpen up the security of Homebase, even if it means putting Commanders and their base through the wringer! Head to your Storm Shield bases and test your defenses against unique and challenging simulations. Complete both daily and weekly quest to earn a fair share of Event Tickets, Gold, Banners, Evolution Materials, and PERK rewards.
 


The Lunar Llama

This little critter can somehow package the might of the Dragon Weapons as well as the Chinese New Year Heroes.
 

 

Wukong 

‚ÄúMy journey never ends!‚Äù - Wukong
 
  • Standard Perk: Explosive Rounds
    • Every 6 ranged weapon eliminations trigger an explosion which deals 37 base damage in a 1 tile radius.
  • Commander Perk: Explosive Rounds+
    • Every 6 ranged weapon eliminations,trigger an explosion which deals 111 base damage in a 1 tile radius.



 

The Dragon‚Äôs Fist

A slow moving hammer that harnesses the power of the great dragons. Unleash the Overhead Smash heavy attack to knockback your enemies and deal increased damage. 
 

No Dancing Questline

The dreaded Love Storm has returned and according to our most trusted Major, this is an extremely dangerous threat! Stop this lovely phenomenon from hitting Homebase and the ‚Äúpremiere matchmaker‚Äù, Stoneheart Farrah, will join your squad. Hope you are ready for a lesson in Love Defense 101!
 

 

Stoneheart Farrah

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs time to harden your hearts‚Äô" - Stoneheart Farrah
 
  • Standard Perk: Cupid's Arrow
    • On Bow hit, arrows splinter, dealing 20% damage to 3 nearby targets.
  • Commander Perk: Cupid's Arrow+
    • On Bow hit, arrows splinter, dealing 60% damage to 5 nearby targets.
 

Coming January 31 (7 PM ET) -  Mist Pods enter Wargames and Snuggle Specialist Sarah embraces the Event Store 

 


Wargames Week 2: Mist Pods

Peas in the pod and bosses in the base. Take down the Mist Pods quickly or else tougher enemies will emerge! 



 

Snuggle Specialist Sarah

‚ÄúDoes somebody need a hug?‚Äù - Snuggle Specialist Sarah
 
  • Standard Perk: Tail of the Dragon
    • Dragon Slash leaves behind an energized trail, dealing 26 base Energy Damage per second.
  • Commander Perk: Tail of the Dragon+
    • Dragon Slash leaves behind an energized trail, dealing 64 base Energy Damage per second and slowing enemies by 30% for 3 seconds.




 

The Robo-Kevin Pack

‚ÄúI HAVE BEEN UPGRADED" - Robo-Kevin

Homebase‚Äôs triangular technologist has made the ultimate upgrade to his favorite nifty gadget - himself! 

The Robo-Kevin Pack brings a new Hero and Outfit, the Whirrr Backbling, the Power Pick Pickaxe, the Robo-Kevin Challenges and access to Save the World. These exclusive Save the World challenges will earn you 1,000 V-Bucks and 1,000 X-Ray Tickets.

The Cosmetic items of this Pack will be shared through Battle Royale, Save the World and Creative game modes. This new Pack series will have no impact on existing Founder daily login rewards or their V-Bucks earned, which is exclusive to early access Founders. These outfits may appear in the item shop in the future.

Now get to mowing down those Husks in the Mild Meadows Commanders!
posts.description: Fortnite Save the World Update: The Mild Meadows and Wargames challenges return!
posts.author: The Fortnite Team

posts.title: Vi from League of Legends and Arcane Unleashes Her Force in Fortnite
posts.content:
After League of Legends‚Äô Jinx made her explosive debut in Fortnite, her sister Vi is breaking into the scene to join her. Based on Riot Games‚Äô acclaimed animated series Arcane, which follows Jinx and Vi, Arcane Vi will be in the Item Shop starting January 22, 2021, at 7 PM ET! Punch up your look with Vi-themed accessories as well.

Missed out on Arcane Jinx? She‚Äôll also be in the Shop starting January 22 at 7 PM ET!


Make an Impact with Arcane Vi and More

The Arcane Vi Outfit will be in the Item Shop alongside more new items of the Arcane: League of Legends Set. Put on the bunny Memories of Zaun Back Bling (sold with the Outfit) as a memento of how far Vi has come, equip Vi's weapon of choice while her gauntlets are being repaired: the Piltover Warden Hammer Pickaxe, and show off her shadowboxing skills with the Punching Practice Emote.



Players will have the option to purchase the Outfit (+ Back Bling), Pickaxe, and Emote in the Arcane Vi Bundle, which additionally includes the Piltover's Finest Loading Screen:

Piltover's Finest: Defends the Island and follows orders... most of the time.


Explosive Re-Entry: Arcane Jinx Back in the Shop

Arcane Jinx and Jinx-themed accessories will be returning to the Shop at the same time Acane Vi debuts in the Shop. In addition to the Arcane Jinx Outfit, have some fun with the Jinx‚Äôs Dream Monkey Back Bling, pick up the Pow Pow Crusher Pickaxe, and pretend Piltover‚Äôs your playground with the Playground (Instrumental) Lobby Track (from the Arcane Original Soundtrack).



With the Arcane Jinx Bundle, get all of these Jinx items plus the Jinxed Spray, Wreaking Havoc Loading Screen, and Katchoo! Loading Screen!

The Wreaking Havoc Loading Screen.
 


The Piltover enforcer is now an enforcer on the Island. Enter the battle as Arcane Vi or drop in as Arcane Jinx.

Want more League of Legends? This free title is available to grab from the Epic Games Store!
posts.description: Vi from League of Legends and Arcane arrives in the Item Shop with the return of her sister Jinx! Get each Outfit of the Arcane: League of Legends Set.
posts.author: The Fortnite Team

posts.title: The Two Hawkeyes: Clint Barton and Kate Bishop Take Aim in Fortnite
posts.content:
They‚Äôre Super Heroes. Seriously. 

Former Avenger Hawkeye (a.k.a. Clint Barton) and his archer superfan Kate Bishop are setting their sights on the Fortnite Island. And these are just two of the items from the new Hawkeye Set!


Looking Sharp: The Hawkeye Set Shown Off

‚ÄúBeing a Super Hero is amazing. Everyone should try it.‚Äù Check out the Clint Barton and Kate Bishop Outfits below! 



The following accessories are available in the Item Shop as well:

  • Hawkguy's Arsenal Back Bling (sold with the Clint Barton Outfit): An old-school timeless quiver.

  • Kate's Quiver Back Bling (sold with the Kate Bishop Outfit): A quiver with a more modern touch.

  • Taut Slicer Pickaxe: Nocked and ready for action.

  • Pickross Bow Pickaxe: Built with a distinctive groove on its handle.

  • Aerial Archer Glider: All that training's gotta be for something.




Players can purchase the Outfits (+ Back Blings), Pickaxes, and Glider individually or as part of the Hawkeye Bundle. This bundle additionally includes the Hawkeyes Loading Screen:

Keep your Hawkeyes on the Prizes.


Battle as Hawkeye new and classic with Kate Bishop and Clint Barton!
posts.description: Both Hawkeyes, Clint Barton and Kate Bishop, arrive in the Fortnite Item Shop. Grab the Outfits of the Hawkeye Set. Read for more details!
posts.author: The Fortnite Team

posts.title: The Fortnite Soundwave Series Continues with Tones And I in an Interactive Madhouse!
posts.content:
October 2021 saw the kickoff of the Fortnite Soundwave Series ‚Äî a series of in-game musical shows featuring artists from around the world. After Egyptian superstar Mohamed Hamaki started off the soundwave, Australian singer-songwriter Tones And I keeps it going with her own show airing back-to-back for 72 hours starting Jan. 21, 2022, at 6 PM ET!

Each show in the Soundwave Series takes place in its own interactive experience, and Tones And I‚Äôs show is no exception. Over the coming months, Brazilian rapper Emicida, Japanese pop artist and music producer Gen Hoshino, and record-breaking French-Malian singer Aya Nakamura will have their own shows to experience in Fortnite. Keep an eye out for details as each artist carries on the soundwave! üéµ


How to Watch the Tones And I Show

Tones And I will be performing songs from her debut studio album Welcome to the Madhouse. To jump in, players can enter the SOUNDWAVE SERIES: TONES AND I tile (or input the Island code 4161-9206-0181) starting Friday, January 21, at 6 PM ET. This interactive experience made by community creators Team Alliance and TheBoyDilly is an adventure through the madhouse ‚Äî a tour inspired by the songs of the album.

The show will repeat non-stop for 72 hours (until Monday, January 24 at 6 PM ET), so don‚Äôt worry if you can‚Äôt jump in right away. Enjoy the show and get the Soundwave Series - Tones And I Spray as a memento! With a second playthrough, you can even get some XP too.



Players also have the option to just watch the show via Picture-in-Picture in Battle Royale playlists and across Creative. This option is available during certain times of the event and is accessible through the settings. (Note: interactive elements will not be playable through Picture-in-Picture.)


Tones And I Lobby Track and Emote



From the Welcome to the Madhouse album, Tones And I‚Äôs ‚ÄúCloudy Day‚Äù will have its own Lobby Track in the Fortnite Item Shop! And step outside the Madhouse with an Emote based on the record-breaking single ‚ÄúDance Monkey‚Äù from her The Kids Are Coming EP. The Cloudy Day Lobby Track and Dance Monkey Emote will be available in the Item Shop starting Wednesday, January 19, at 7 PM ET, before the event.

The second show of the Soundwave Series is almost here. üéôÔ∏è


Tones And I Show Content Creation

Content creators in the Support-A-Creator (SAC) program will be able to host VOD content from the Tones And I show on YouTube and monetize it. Monetization of VOD content will be active for seven days, and no takedown notifications should occur afterwards. More info:

  • In order to monetize their Tones And I show content, SAC members need to link their YouTube and Support-A-Creator accounts.

  • IMPORTANT: When uploading the content to YouTube, be sure to upload it as Unlisted or Public. If you upload the video as Private, it is possible you could receive a monetization claim on your video.

  • For uploading the content on other platforms, refer to your channel‚Äôs platform policies for tips on how to avoid copyright strikes.

  • Not in SAC? Don‚Äôt worry, you can still share your highlights from the experience. However, you will not be able to monetize this content on YouTube.


Please note: For Twitch creators streaming Tones And I‚Äôs show, we cannot prevent your VODs or clips from getting flagged by third-party copyright detection systems. The general recommendation is to disable VODs/clips for the duration of the event. For more information, see Twitch‚Äôs DMCA & Copyright FAQs help page.

PHOTOSENSITIVITY/SEIZURES WARNING
‚ÄúSoundwave Series: Tones And I‚Äù has flashing lights. If you have a history of photosensitivity, consult a doctor before entering the event. IMMEDIATELY DISCONTINUE if you experience any discomfort.
posts.description: The Fortnite Soundwave Series announces a show by Tones And I repeating 72 hours starting Jan 21, 2022! Earn a special Spray for attending. Also get a Tones And I Lobby Track and Emote in the Shop!
posts.author: The Fortnite Team

posts.title: Fortnite Battle Royale v19.10 Update: Battle Atop Tilted Towers and Klombos!
posts.content:
Not only has a classic POI been unearthed on the Island, but a new legendary creature has appeared as well‚Ä¶ Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs new in Fortnite Battle Royale v19.10!


The Klombos Come Forth



It‚Äôs been long theorized there was a large creature on the Island, but alas, it hasn‚Äôt been found. Until now! And it‚Äôs actually no ‚Äúit‚Äù‚Äî there‚Äôs more than one stomping around the Island. Don‚Äôt worry, though. Despite their enormous size, these creatures called Klombos are completely peaceful. (Unless provoked, but still.) 

How can these gentle giants help you in battle? Ascend their tails to get to the blowhole on their heads, then get launched a great distance upwards to escape a tricky situation. They‚Äôve also been known to sneeze out items after snacking a bit!


Klomberry Irresistible



The Klombo diet is very diverse ‚Äî they‚Äôll eat just about anything you throw in front of them. But what they love most is Klomberries! Pick these fruits from small bushes around the Island, then throw one near a Klombo to lead it your way. Remember: after Klombos snack a bit, items spout out! Have you accidentally (or purposefully‚Ä¶) provoked a Klombo? Calm its rage with none other than a Klomberry.

Fun fact: Klomberries also have nutritional value for non-Klombos. Consume one for a bump in Effective Health! 


The Return of Tilted Towers



The Island‚Äôs thaw goes on, and Tilted Towers has emerged from underneath the snow and ice! Go out on the town with this classic POI from Fortnite‚Äôs past: build to the top of its iconic clock tower, bust into apartments, stop by restaurants, battle it out in the underground parking garage, storm No Sweat Insurance‚Äôs office, and more on your urban excursion.


Grenade Launcher Unvaulted and Adjusted



The Grenade Launcher is back and we've made some tweaks to its responsiveness! Projectiles now explode after their first bounce and fire more directly at your target. 

You can find Grenade Launchers from Rare Chests, Supply Drops, and‚Ä¶ sharks. 


You Dropped This üëë



With v19.10, the Crowning Achievement Emote now displays more than 99 Crowned Victory Royales. If you had reached more than 99 before v19.10 (super impressive), your crowns were still being tracked and are now updated accordingly!


In Case You Missed It: Last Week‚Äôs Balance Changes Hotfix

Balance changes made in a hotfix last week:


Stinger SMG


 

  • Decreased the damage of the Stinger SMG.



MK-Seven Assault Rifle


 

  • Slightly decreased the damage of the MK-Seven Assault Rifle.



Auto Shotgun


 

  • Increased the reload speed of the Auto Shotgun.


Competitive Notes

  • Klombos and Grenade Launchers are not included in competitive playlists. Klomberries are included, however.

  • Shield Kegs have been added to competitive playlists.

  • Armored Walls have been added to competitive playlists, at a reduced pick-up limit.


Major Bug Fixes

  • Fixed an issue involving Spider-Man‚Äôs Web-Shooters getting interrupted after players swung onto web bouncers.

  • Fixed an issue involving players encountering a ‚ÄúNetwork Connection Lost‚Äù error when trying to join a match as a spectator. With this issue fixed, the option to join a match as a spectator has been re-enabled.

  • Fixed an issue that caused us to disable healing from resting in a Tent. Healing from resting in a Tent is now re-enabled.

  • Fixed an issue involving campfires sometimes not healing players.

  • Fixed an issue that caused us to disable DLSS for DirectX 11. DLSS for DirectX 11 is now re-enabled.

  • Fixed an issue involving Daily Quests not being visible in the Quests tab after players returned from a non-core mode.
posts.description: New legendary creatures called Klombos, as well as the return of Tilted Towers, are part of the Fortnite Battle Royale v19.10 update!
posts.author: The Fortnite Team

posts.title: Explore the ‚ÄúKAWS NEW FICTION‚Äù Art Exhibit in Fortnite, Based on the Serpentine North Gallery in London
posts.content:
Made by creator team BeyondCreative with the support of Alliance Studios, jump into a recreation of the Serpentine North Gallery in Fortnite! This art gallery in Kensington Gardens in London is known for presenting boundary-pushing contemporary art. 

The gallery‚Äôs "KAWS NEW FICTION" exhibition has just opened, showcasing paintings and sculptures ‚Äî as well as augmented reality artworks developed with Acute Art ‚Äî by world-renowned artist KAWS. Fortnite players can jump into the KAWS & Serpentine Hub to explore the show in-game! Here are some preview shots of the experience, going live on January 18, 2021, at 10 AM ET:











This Hub marks the second time KAWS has come to Fortnite (following the KAWS Skeleton Outfit in Fortnitemares 2021), and the first time a real-world art gallery was recreated in the game. 

The KAWS & Serpentine Hub will be the Featured Hub from 10 AM ET on January 18 to 10 AM ET on January 25. Access it from the Creative playlist or with the Island code 9441-7852-6686. Want to visit the experience beyond January 25? You can! The Hub will still be accessible via the Island code.

Appreciate art alongside others in the community!
posts.description: Explore the KAWS NEW FICTION art exhibit in Fortnite. This exhibit from London‚Äôs Serpentine North Gallery will be the Featured Hub and will still be accessible after it‚Äôs featured!
posts.author: The Fortnite Team

posts.title: Fortnite Creative v19.10 Update
posts.content:
The v19.10 update is starting the year off with some big new features, including many community requested features! The Real Time clock, Map/Scoreboard, Creative Name Tags, Creature Manager all receive updates. We‚Äôve also added some awesome new devices including the Prop Manipulator, Player Counter, and the Pop-up Dialog device.

Creators, as a reminder the Fortnite Creative Documentation Site is updated with additional details, use cases, and thought starters for newly released  and updated devices. 

Note: With 19.10 we've introduced a new feature called Contextual Filtering. This feature hides or displays options depending on the values selected for certain related options. For example, on the new Prop Manipulation device, when the Affects All Objects option is set to In a Zone, three additional options display that allow you to set the Height, Width and Depth of the zone. This feature is added to just a few devices in this release, but we will be adding it to other devices in future updates. This feature will reduce clutter in the Customize panel and make options easier to manage and navigate.

New: Prop Manipulator device

Possibly one of the most requested features ever - this device provides the ability to manipulate the visibility and collision of props, as well as override their health values and send signals when they get damaged or destroyed. Simply attach the device to a single prop or make it into a volume to encompass any number of props and you can toggle the visibility of those props with transmitters as well as perform a few other nifty functions.

We plan to add more features to the Prop Manipulator in future releases to give you even more control over your worlds.

For more details, we‚Äôve added the Prop Manipulation device to the Fortnite Creative Documentation site.

New: Icon Library

We‚Äôve added a new library of 90 icons that can be attached to various devices to add some flavor and context to your experiences.  These can be used to show points of interest on the map, lead players to specific areas or objects, or give context to devices like the Capture Area.  

We‚Äôll be adding new icons to the library and adding icon support to more devices in future updates.

The devices which can utilize the Icon Library from this release are:

  • Accolade Device
  • Beacons
  • Capture Area
  • Explosive Device
  • Map Marker
  • Player Counter
  • Ball Spawner

We had hoped to include support for the Objective Device gallery in this initial release, but it proved a little more tricky than expected, so you can expect it to be added in an upcoming release in the near future.

New: Player Counter device

The Player Counter device provides two major new features to empower Creators to control the flow and balance of games:

  • It allows you to check how many players are in a specific area (with optional team and class filters), compare it against a target number and then send a signal based on whether it passes or fails the comparison.
  • It allows a signal to be sent whenever a player joins or leaves a game in progress.

There are a whole bunch of different options and subtle tweaks that make this device extremely powerful, so be sure to check out the full documentation for it and spend some time experimenting to unlock its full potential.

For more details, we‚Äôve added the Player Counter device to the Fortnite Creative Documentation site.

New: Pop-up Dialog Device

The Pop-up Dialog device allows you to display information to players in a completely new way! With up to two customizable button responses and the option to use simple markup within the text, you can now create information boxes and tutorials, or link dialogs together to create branching choices.

We plan to add more customization options to the Pop-up Dialog device in future releases.

Here are the markup codes you can currently use in the dialog text to format it:

  • <cr> - moves the text to a new line (Body text only)
  • {playername} - displays the name of the player viewing the dialog.

For more details, we‚Äôve added the Pop-up Dialog device to the Fortnite Creative Documentation site.

Update: Real Time Clock

Get your event countdown ready! We‚Äôre updating the Real Time Clock device with two heavily requested features: 

  • You can now set the RTC to automatically repeat at set intervals of hours, days, weeks or months - a specified number of times or even infinitely.
  • You can now define a duration for the clock and have a transmitter fire when the duration elapses.

We‚Äôve updated our Fortnite Creative Real Time Clock Device documentation with the details you need to set yourself up for running an event using the Real Time Clock.

Update: Creature Manager

Another heavily requested feature from the community: the Creature Manager device can now be enabled and disabled via channels, allowing you to easily create ramping difficulty levels by switching between managers during a game.

Update: Map/Scoreboard

We‚Äôve updated the map and scoreboard to make it possible to view both screens in one location and to remove the necessity for map and scoreboard display to be an either/or option in the settings. The Map Screen Display setting in the My Island UI screen will determine which screen is shown by default when the player presses the Map key, but they will then be able to switch between the two using tabs at the top of the screen.

If you don‚Äôt want players to be able to see the map for whatever reason, we‚Äôve added a Display Overview Map option - setting it to NO will simply show ‚ÄòMap Not Available‚Äô when players switch to the Map tab.

Update: Creative Name Tags

We‚Äôve added a number of new options to the My Island settings screen and Team Settings and Class Designer devices to provide more control over when and how player name tags are displayed to help Creators cut down on visual noise during their experiences.

The old Player Names & Location option has now been renamed to Always Show Name Plates and the values have been renamed slightly:

  • Team Only > Always Show to Team
  • Always Show > Always Show to All
  • Always Hide > Always Hide (No change)
  • No (New option)

When set to ALWAYS SHOW TO TEAM, friendly players will always be able to see your Name Plate, but enemies will follow the rules set with the new options we‚Äôve added.

When set to NO, Name Plates will be shown to or hidden from all players based on the rules set by the new options:

  • Name Plate Max Distance
    • Causes Name Plates to be hidden if a player is too far away from an observer.
  • Name Plate Line of Sight
    • Requires an observer to have an unobstructed line of sight to see a Name Plate.
  • Focus For Name Plates
    • Requires an observer to actually focus on a player to see their Name Plate using the following parameters: 
  • Focus Angle
    • Requires a player to be within this angle of an observer‚Äôs reticle to display the Name Plate.  Only functional if Focus For Name Plates is set to ON.
  • Focus Time
    • Requires a player to be within the Focus Angle for the specified length of time before their Name Plate becomes visible.  Only functional if Focus For Name Plates is set to ON.

Other Device Updates

  • HUD Controller device
    • The Map/Scoreboard button prompt can now be shown/hidden.
  • Matchmaking Portal
    • Players playing in Private mode can now start the game manually before the pre-game countdown has elapsed.
  • Switch device
    • Added unlit versions of the default model and Antique Lever model.
  • VFX Device
    • Added Laserbeam effect from Party Royale.
    • Added Snow particle effect.

Prefab & Gallery Updates

  • Added 6 New Sanctuary Prefabs
    • Sanctuary House
    • Sanctuary Hydroponic Station
    • Sanctuary Assembly Building
    • Sanctuary Market Building
    • Sanctuary Farming Hut
    • Sanctuary Fishing Hut
  • Added 7 New Sanctuary Galleries
    • Sanctuary Floor & Stair Gallery
    • Sanctuary Wall Gallery
    • Sanctuary Curved Wall Gallery
    • Sanctuary Roof Gallery
    • Sanctuary Mighty Monument Gallery
    • Sanctuary Prop Gallery
    • Sanctuary Nature Gallery

Prefab & Gallery Fixes

  • Fixed an issue with assets from the Primitive Shapes Gallery not showing the correct material when chosen.
  • Fixed an issue with two different Skyscraper Galleries sharing the same name.
  • Fixed an issue with the preview volume being too small for the Snow Dune Gallery and the Tan Cliff Cave Gallery.
  • Fixed an issue with some assets from the Tan Cliff Cave Gallery not showing correct asset icons.
  • Fixed an issue with rocks from the Variant Rock Gallery which had a wet looking material.
  • Fixed an issue with some buildings from Background Building Gallery C not dropping resource materials.
  • Fixed an issue where some cubes from the Cube Gallery had overlying asset copies.

Device Fixes

  • Fixed an issue with the Player Reference device that caused it to not transmit channels when players stats changed.
  • Fixed an issue where gravity was inconsistently applied to items spawned by Item Spawners.
  • Fixed an issue where devices would appear as the wrong color when high resolution textures are unchecked.
  • Fixed an issue where the Character device would fail to display ‚ÄúLove Hands‚Äù.
  • Fixed an issue where the Character device would remain visible even when the visibility setting was set to off.
  • Fixed an issue where the Character device would display corrupted textures when placed after resizing.
  • Fixed an issue where the interaction radius on a Switch device wouldn‚Äôt disable when the switch device became disabled.
  • Fixed an issue where the Radio device would play the default song continuously. 
  • Fixed an issue where the Target Dummy wouldn't lay down when it gets disabled through channels.
  • Fixed an issue where the DBNO device would ignore certain settings if multiple devices existed.

Island Fixes

  • Fixed an issue where trees on Survival Island did not show the correct LOD textures on mobile.
  • Fixed an issue where Survival Island‚Äôs memory meter would stop and break at 72k.
  • Fixed an issue where Island Rifts weren‚Äôt appearing by default in Creative Hubs.
  • Fixed an issue where personal XL island settings would get overwritten by featured XL island settings.
  • Fixed an issue where deleting a cave entrance in Survival XL Island with Caves would reveal a hole in the terrain.

Gameplay Fixes

  • Fixed an issue that caused players to be unable to interact with a button that provided Gold resources. 
  • Fixed an issue that caused walls to break when aiming out of a vehicle despite settings. 
  • Fixed an issue where weapons weren‚Äôt being auto picked up when Auto Pickup Weapons was enabled
  • Fixed an issue that caused the Inflate-a-Bull to not bounce.
  • Fixed an issue where player tenacity reduced to 100 hp after going DBNO instead of matching player health before going down.  To allow the previous functionality to be retained, this behavior can now be selected as an option on the device.
  • Fixed an issue where save data failed to load resulting in devices saving nonexistent progress overriding old data.
  • Fixed an issue where players couldn‚Äôt fire the UFO projectile.
  • Fixed an issue where the Crash Pad wouldn‚Äôt display properly.
  • Fixed an issue where a player couldn‚Äôt use their Phone Tool when the Infinity Blade was in their inventory.
  • Fixed an issue where enemy Creatures could pass through walls.

UI Fixes

  • Fixed an issue where multi-selecting objects then leaving those objects‚Äô render distance would deselect the objects.
  • Fixed an issue where the Character and Dance Mannequin devices couldn't be multi-selected.
  • Fixed an issue where the contextual menu would sometimes disappear.
  • Fixed an issue where the inventory from a previous island would visually carry over when a new island is created.
  • Fixed a visual issue that would cause Fog from a VFXs spawner to highlight in strange ways.
  • Fixed an issue where items couldn‚Äôt be selected in a mutator zone after starting a game.
posts.description: The Fortnite Creative v19.10 Update is packed including the Prop Manipulator Device, Icon Library, Player Counter Device and more! Read for details.
posts.author: The Fortnite Team

posts.title: PSA: Fortnite Map Locations Not Translated in 19.10
posts.content:
A bug present in Fortnite Update 19.10 is causing Locations, Points of Interest and Landmarks on the Battle Royale map to appear in English instead of in your selected language. The names of these Locations will not match the named locations in Quests, but Quests can still be completed as normal.

Tracking a Quest, placing a marker on the minimap, or viewing the Quest in your Quest tab will appear at the correct location, and all objectives and Discovery XP are still available.

Here‚Äôs a list of all Points of Interest on the map and how they may appear in-game. We‚Äôll provide an update to this article when the issue is resolved.

 
In-Game Location Translated Location
Logjam Lumberyard Logjam Lumberyard
Sleepy Sound Sleepy Sound
Shifty Shafts Shifty Shafts
The Daily Bugle The Daily Bugle
Coney Crossroads Coney Crossroads
Camp Cuddle Camp Cuddle
Tilted Towers Tilted Towers
Sanctuary Sanctuary
Greasy Grove Greasy Grove
Rocky Reels Rocky Reels
The Joneses The Joneses
Condo Canyon Condo Canyon
Chonker's Speedway Chonker's Speedway
posts.description: Fortnite Update 19.10 is causing a Map Location translation bug. Quests can still be completed and here is a guide on identifying locations for now.
posts.author: The Fortnite Team

posts.title: Fortnite Battle Royale v19.01 - Jan 11 Hotfix: Tornadoes and Lightning Crop Up!
posts.content:
Today‚Äôs forecast predicts tornadoes and lightning joining the Island‚Äôs elements. Find out below how to use this new weather to your advantage! And speaking of weather, turn up the temperature with the unvaulted Flare Gun. üî•


Twister and Shock: New Weather Explained

If you see a tornado start to form, that‚Äôs no signal to flee. Instead, run into it as a swirling escape strategy! You‚Äôll spin round and round ‚Äòtil you choose to glide to safety ‚Äî or if you stay spinning long enough ‚Äî ‚Äòtil the twister spits you out. Don‚Äôt worry: you won‚Äôt take fall damage if you get hurled.

If you see a dark cloud start to form, that‚Äôs not necessarily a signal to flee either. Sure, the lightning from it deals a small amount of damage (and sets the surrounding area on fire) but the power of its shock gives players a temporary speed boost. 

How to increase your chance of getting struck by lightning? Jump into a body of water beneath the cloud, or reach the highest land point under it! Lightning doesn‚Äôt strike twice back-to-back ‚Äî once you‚Äôve been struck, lightning won‚Äôt strike you again right after. 


Flare Gun Also in the Forecast‚Ä¶ to be Unvaulted Now!

Don‚Äôt leave it up to just lightning to start fires. With this hotfix, the Flare Gun has been unvaulted! So now in addition to Firefly Jars, you can spark Flare Guns to make use of spreading flames. Find Flare Guns in Chests, on the ground, and from Supply Drops!


Tornado Week: The Twisters Intensify

The cyclones are at high intensity to mark this climate shake-up. 

In Tornado Week, running from now to January 17 at 9 AM ET, there‚Äôs a higher percent chance you‚Äôll encounter tornadoes around the Island for their debut. The wind is at your back! 
 


Competitive notes:

  • Tornadoes and lightning are not included in competitive playlists.

  • Flare Guns are currently not in competitive playlists but are subject to an evaluation period.

    • During this Season, items like the Flare Gun and Shield Keg could potentially be introduced to competitive playlists after a one-to-two week evaluation period. In this Season in particular, we're evaluating the viability of more mid-Season items introduced to competitive playlists than in recent previous Seasons.
posts.description: Storms are brewing in Fortnite. Watch out for tornadoes and lightning in the Fortnite Battle Royale v19.01 Jan 11 hotfix. Read for more details!
posts.author: The Fortnite Team

posts.title: Save the World | Homebase Status Report 1.11.2022
posts.content:
Welcome back Commanders,

Thank you for joining us in the first Homebase Status Report of the year!

A new year tends to spell the end of the holidays, but you still have time to experience the joy of the Winterfest Ventures Season, as it comes to a close on January 24 at 7 PM ET.

Now let‚Äôs find out what else Winterfest has to offer before it melts away. Homebase Status Report - Initiate !
 

Update 1/18
 
Hey there Commanders, it‚Äôs Lars. I‚Äôve been researching some stuff in my lab and noticed a recent change in behavior from The Storm that you are gonna wanna hear about.

Some Commanders tend to use a certain building technique during ‚Äúdefend the objective‚Äù missions, which allows their structures to pretty much do all the work for them. Hey I‚Äôm not judging; I also like to kick my feet up and spend some time just enjoying a good tune once in a while‚Ä¶ But I don‚Äôt think Commanders can get away with that anymore. The Storm seems to have noticed this building technique, and has made adjustments against it; that's just freaky man!

It seems Husks that stay stuck on the field for a while will be reabsorbed by The Storm, and then replaced by new, fresh Husks. This must be a way The Storm keeps its Husks alert, active, and always ready to tear apart your structures.

I don‚Äôt know what The Storm is feeding these Husks, but it sure seems to be working. Higher level Husk will have an easier time clawing through your defense, so watch out in those more difficult Zones. 

To counter these buffed up Husks, we have strengthened our traps!  Husks will no longer become immune to our control traps, no matter how many times you stun, snare or freeze 'em. What does Major Oswald like to say again? No Mercy?

This proves my theory that The Storm is smarter than we think so as our tactics change, so will The Storm‚Äôs. We gotta be ready for anything. Good luck Commander, we are gonna need you more than ever now.

Signing off-

Lars,

Steel Wool Guitarist and Lead Storm Scientist

 

Available Now - Cloaked Shadow Has Emerged into the Event Store and Frostnite offers one final challenge! 

 




Cloaked Shadow


‚ÄúAlways lurking..‚Äù - Cloaked Shadow
 
  • Standard Perk: Corrupted Aura
    • During Shadow Stance, deal 6 base damage per second to nearby enemies
  • Commander Perk: Corrupted Aura+
    • During Shadow Stance, deal 20 base damage per second to nearby enemies
 


Frostnite Weekly Challenge 7: Final Frost

It‚Äôs time for one final Frostnite Challenge! Final Frost combines mechanics from Frosty Turf, New Wave Holiday, Superheated, and Top It Off.

Overcome this ultimate challenge and you will be rewarded with a unique banner as well as the ferocious Shark Attack Launcher! 



The Shark Attack!

A bold collaboration between expert toymaker, Ted, and Homebase‚Äôs Weaponsmith, Clip. This launcher fires bouncy toy shark grenades that damage groups of enemies when they detonate. 

 

Coming January 15 (7 PM ET) - The Snowball Launcher Hurls Its Way into the Event Store 




Snowball fight! Launch icy explosions towards your enemies with this frosty launcher.
 


The Robo Kevin Pack


‚ÄúI HAVE BEEN UPGRADED" - Robo-Kevin

Homebase‚Äôs triangular technologist has made the ultimate upgrade to his favorite nifty gadget - himself! 

The Robo-Kevin Pack brings a new Hero and Outfit, the Whirrr Backbling, the Power Pick Pickaxe, the Robo-Kevin Challenges and access to Save the World. These exclusive Save the World challenges will earn you 1,000 V-Bucks and 1,000 X-Ray Tickets.

The Cosmetic items of this Pack will be shared through Battle Royale, Save the World and Creative game modes. This new Pack series will have no impact on existing Founder daily login rewards or their V-Bucks earned, which is exclusive to early access Founders. These outfits may appear in the item shop in the future.

Best of luck in the Final Frost Commanders!

posts.title: Fortnite Battle Royale v19.01 - Jan 4 Hotfix
posts.content:
Last week saw the unvaulting of Clingers, and now this week sees the debut of a new item. A perfect complement to Med-Mist, say hello to the Shield Keg!


The Shield Keg: Restore All Shields Around It



You can spray a Med-Mist ‚Äî introduced in v19.00 ‚Äî to restore your or your allies‚Äô Health. With the new Shield Keg, throw it down to restore your whole squad‚Äôs Shields! This Shield fountain spouts more than long enough to restore a player‚Äôs Shield from 0 to 100. But be careful where you throw one down, as it can restore enemies‚Äô Shields too.

Find Shield Kegs in Chests, on the ground, and from Supply Drops. Also exchange Bars for them from Lt. John Llama and The Scientist! 


Winterfest ‚ÄúWrapping‚Äù Up



As a reminder, Winterfest ends January 6 at 9 AM ET. Unwrap 14 gift items ‚Äî two Outfits included, complete Sgt. Winter‚Äôs Quests for XP and more, and unlock items by playing Creator-made Winterfest games! Also, as one of the Epic Games Store Epic Deals, get another gift Outfit by logging into Fortnite from the Epic Games Launcher then redeeming it from the Item Shop. 

And that‚Äôs a wrap for now. Assemble your squad ‚Äòround a replenishing Shield Keg!

posts.title: Snow Stealth Slone Counters the Cold in the January Fortnite Crew Pack
posts.content:
Fortnite Crew Benefits:

  • January Crew Pack

  • Fortnite Crew Legacy Set (available until December 31 at 7 PM ET)

  • Golden Look Board Glider

  • Chapter 3 Season 1 Battle Pass

  • 1,000 V-Bucks Every Month

  • December Crew Pack (available until December 31 at 7 PM ET)
     


Adjusting to the Island‚Äôs current conditions, Doctor Slone has equipped herself with a new, winter uniform. Now, Slone‚Äôs ready for the frostiest of stealth missions (and the slopes). 

Snow Stealth Slone starts her chilling domination in the January 2022 Crew Pack, which goes live for active Fortnite Crew subscribers at approximately 7 PM ET on December 31, 2021.


Weather the Winter with the January Crew Pack

At Snow Stealth Slone‚Äôs disposal is more than just her warm uniform. In addition to Snow Stealth Slone herself, the January Crew Pack includes the Snow Stealth Hardcase Back Bling (an IO-issued snow survival pack), the tundra-tested Sleet Spike Pickaxe, and, matching the uniform, the Snow Stealth Wrap.

Snow Stealth Slone packed an alt Style for her Outfit, the Back Bling, and Pickaxe: the Winter Sunset Style. 


More Fortnite Crew Benefits: Legacy Set, Winterfest Glider, Season 1 Battle Pass, Monthly V-Bucks, and More!


Leaving Soon: Fortnite Crew Legacy Set

As previously announced, players have until December 31, 2021, at 7 PM ET to unlock the Protocol Pack Back Bling. This Back Bling is part of the Fortnite Crew Legacy Set. For every month you‚Äôre an active Fortnite Crew subscriber, you‚Äôll unlock a new Stage in the Set for up to six total Stages. The Stages unlock on the 14th of each month during your subscription (at 8 PM EDT / 7 PM EST).

Stage 1 unlocks upon subscribing to Fortnite Crew. The Set includes the Back Bling, which gets a new Style with Stages 2 and 3 ‚Äî then a Pickaxe that unlocks at Stage 3 and gets a new Style with Stages 4, 5, and 6.


Golden Look Board Glider

Winterfest is happening in Fortnite ‚Äòtil January 6, 2022, at 9 AM ET! As a Fortnite Crew bonus during Winterfest, active Fortnite Crew subscribers will receive the Golden Look Board Glider upon logging into the event. As you can guess from the name, its design is based on the same genius-slash-espionage expert who united The First Shadows.

He is watching‚Ä¶


Chapter 3 Season 1 Battle Pass

Fortnite Crew subscribers always have instant access to the current Season‚Äôs Battle Pass. This means that active subscribers during the present Chapter 3 Season 1 automatically get its Battle Pass.

If you had already bought the Chapter 3 Season 1 Battle Pass before subscribing during the Season, a one-time 950 V-Bucks return will be applied to your account.


1,000 V-Bucks Every Month

Active Fortnite Crew subscribers receive 1,000 V-Bucks every month! These V-Bucks are received on the day of subscribers‚Äô billing date*. Signed up on December 28, 2021? You‚Äôll be granted 1,000 V-Bucks upon sign-up, then while subscribed, 1,000 V-Bucks on January 28, 2022, on February 28, 2022, and so on.

Remember: Because you receive these V-Bucks on the day of your billing date, they aren‚Äôt attached to when you receive the monthly Crew Pack.


December Crew Pack: The Cube Assassin Crosses Realms

If you played in Chapter 2 Season 8, there‚Äôs a good chance you fought the Cube Assassin countless times in ‚ÄúThe Sideways.‚Äù For December, the Cube Assassin broke out of The Sideways and into the Crew Pack. Interested in the Outfit but haven‚Äôt added it to your collection? No need to worry: the December Crew Pack is available until December 31 at 7 PM ET (when players begin to receive January‚Äôs Crew Pack). 



As well as the Cube Assassin Outfit, the December Crew Pack contains cubic accessories: The Cubist Back Bling, Cube Edge Pickaxe, and Assassin's Mark Wrap. The Outfit and accessories are all reactive!
 




Signing up to Fortnite Crew is available in-game from either the Item Shop or Battle Pass tab. For more details on the subscription, check out our Fortnite Crew FAQ!

Important: To claim the January Crew Pack, you may need to log in from your original purchasing platform if it has been more than 30 days since your last login from that platform. 

*Recurring $11.99 (or local pricing) subscription fee charged monthly until cancelled. You can cancel anytime. See Subscription Terms for complete details, including how to cancel. Please note that Fortnite Crew subscription prices for certain regions will be updated at a later date to match other pricing adjustments. Visit our most recent Pricing Alignment blog post to see these Fortnite Crew pricing updates.
posts.description: January‚Äôs Fortnite Crew benefits include the Snow Stealth Slone Outfit, a Back Bling, Pickaxe, and Wrap in the Crew Pack, plus 1,000 V-Bucks and the Battle Pass!

posts.title: Interviewing the June 2021 Fortnite Concept Royale Winners: Ladiale and Alta!
posts.content:
Back in June‚Äôs Concept Royale, we reached out to the community for their most festive, frosty, and fun concepts to be turned into in-game Outfits. The results? The designs of community members Ladiale (@lbdart_) and Alta (@AltaCalls) blew us away! Based on their designs, the Nalia and Frigid Foregoer Outfits will be making their Item Shop debut on December 23 at 7 PM ET. 

From left to right: Nalia, based on Ladiale‚Äôs design, and Frigid Foregoer, based on Alta‚Äôs design.


We asked Ladiale and Alta about their concepts‚Äô inspirations, their artistic background, how it feels to win Concept Royale, and more:

Where did you get the inspiration for your concept?

Ladiale: The inspiration is ... a barn owl. I think they're majestic animals with a lot of prejudices and stigmas around them. I designed the concept based on the animal, having the little red riding hood in my mind too. 

Alta: The idea of him being a frozen skeleton just came from my mind as I‚Äôve loved the previous skeleton skins in Fortnite and that's when my mind went click and smashed the two ideas together!


How does it feel to win Concept Royale and to see your concept in Fortnite?

Ladiale: It's something I still can't believe. It feels like at any moment someone would just come and say there was a mistake, it's absolutely insane. But I'm grateful, it's not something I expected to happen at all and it inspires me to keep on creating and going on.

Alta: It‚Äôs honestly a dream come true for me. I‚Äôve always loved making characters in my own time and giving them all sorts of stories and designs. When I saw the contest I knew I had to enter it. I knew it would be tough with how much talent there is in this community and I wasn‚Äôt wrong. The [concepts] that came out of the contest were just incredible! Finally seeing one of my ideas and one of my own characters in Fortnite is a feeling I just can‚Äôt describe. 


When did you first start creating Outfit concepts/become an artist?

Ladiale: Nalia was my first Outfit concept for Fortnite. It was my first time creating something for the community. Actually I had a lot of doubts and high expectations at the same time. But I've been a character designer and artist for many years now, I'm not professional at all, but I've been a self-taught artist since 2016. I always wanted to create my own stories and becoming an artist felt necessary.

Alta: I‚Äôve been doing art my whole life, but I moved into 3D art around the start of 2017! I always did it as a hobby and to make any idea that came into my head. I first started making Fortnite Outfit concepts around the summer of 2020 after my friend had pitched me a simple skin idea based on the Chaos Agent Outfit! 


What is your favorite thing about Fortnite?

Ladiale: My favorite thing is the experience to share and create experiences with other players, the artistic direction, the vivid colors, and the huge diversity of designs and items.

Alta: It‚Äôs really hard to say as there‚Äôs just so much I love about this game, but if I had to pick one thing I would have to say the story. It feels so special to me and so unique. I love seeing all these different events transpire and reacting to them with my friends.


Which element from your concept do you feel represents you the most?

Ladiale: That's a hard question to answer, but I'd say the mask and the mantle. In the past I used to represent my avatars with mantles of the same fashion.

Alta: I would have to say the whole idea of this [concept] being based around a cowboy. I‚Äôve always loved western movies and shows and I‚Äôve always loved characters that are designed around that theme.


How would you describe your concept in three short words?

Ladiale: Oniric, vibrant, encouraging

Alta: Vengeful, cold, ruthless


Tell us a fun fact about yourself!

Ladiale: I wasn't going to take part in the contest in the first place, but a friend challenged me to do it for a gift! And well my boyfriend‚Äôs support was a key for all this.

Alta: I absolutely adore roguelike games! They‚Äôve become one of my favourite game genres recently!
 


Nalia and Frigid Foregoer enter Fortnite as part of the Winterfest 2021 event, which you can read about in our Winterfest blog post!
posts.description: Read our interview w/ Ladiale and Alta, talented community artists and the winners of June 2021‚Äôs Fortnite Concept Royale. They created the concepts for the upcoming Nalia and Frigid Foregoer Outfits!
posts.author: The Fortnite Team
